intro: Rubus tenuatispinus, commonly known as the slender-spined blackberry, is a species of brambles belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its hardy nature, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
